title: Workers trapped in Yarmouth trench collapse
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Local News One worker is receiving life-saving measures after being extricated from the trench.
ShareSend this article to your social connections.
Workers were trapped in a trench following a collapse in South Yarmouth on Tuesday morning.

title: Red Sox seen as ‘strongest contender’ to sign Pete Alonso away from Mets
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Morning Sports Update "Either they bring back Bregman, or they make an all-out pursuit for Pete Alonso.

title: Bail set for N.H. man in Peabody rape cold case
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Crime Prosecutors allege Darrell Lavoie blindfolded and raped a woman at knifepoint 34 years ago.
By Abby Patkin November 18, 2025 | 10:11 AM 1 minute to read A New Hampshire man was held on $100,000 bail Monday as he faces charges in a 1991 rape cold case out of Peabody.
Darrell Lavoie, 59, of Nashua, pleaded not guilty in September to charges of aggravated rape, rape, assault with a dangerous weapon, and breaking and entering, court records show.

title: AI-generated country hit tops Billboard chart, using tech built in Massachusetts
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Business The platform behind the song, Suno – developed in Cambridge – is slated to become a $2 billion player in the music industry.
But controversy surrounds the concept.
Portrait of Mikey Shulman, co-founder of Suno in his company’s Cambridge offices.

title: Brian Walshe changes plea to guilty on 2 charges
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Crime Walshe is still charged with first-degree murder for allegedly killing his wife, Ana, on New Year's Day 2023.
By Beth Treffeisen updated on November 18, 2025 | 10:37 AM Less than a minute to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.

With jury selection set to begin Tuesday, Brian Walshe changed his plea to guilty on two of the three charges he’s facing: willfully misleading a police investigation and willfully conveying away a human body or the remains thereof.

title: MSPCA removes 62 animals from horrible conditions in Dudley
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Local News The animals included chickens, ducks, geese, cats, dogs, parrots, ferrets, horses, rabbits, turtles, pigs, and goats, the MSPCA said.
ShareSend this article to your social connections.
MSCPA-Angell reportedly removed 62 animals from unsanitary conditions in a Dudley home on Friday.
